title: Birthright: A Vision into the Plight of Southeastern Indigenous Culture through the Eyes of Guernica
creator: John Henry Gloyne
description: A "remix of Picassos Guernica" that "depicts the horrors of colonialism and mound desecration from a Cherokee perspective."
subject: Cherokee;animals;death;mound

title: Jar
creator: Unknown
description: A porcelain jar from the Kangxi era (1662-1722) containing European bronze mounts.
subject: vase;porcelain

title: Turkey Feather Mantle
creator: Lisa Rutherford
description: A "mantle made of twine hemp fabric, with turkey feathers twined or woven into the textile."
subject: Cherokee;animals;clothing

title: Montera (Hat)
creator: Once Known Yampara Creator
description: "The design of a montera is meant to evoke a 16th century Spanish conquistador helmet. In ceremonial dance attire, the Yampara of Tarabuco, Bolivia, wear montera and spurs as a form of satire against the Spanish invasion and colonization of the Andes."
subject: clothing;hat

title: Uchikake (Bridal Outer Robe)
creator: Once Known Japanese Creator
description: "The uchikake is the traditional outer robe of Japanese brides. They are typically red, black, or white, and the padded hem creates an elegant, seamless flow. This uchikake is adorned with peacocks, symbols of love and fidelity, and chrysanthemums, symbols of regal beauty."
subject: clothing;robe
